location.brewery_address: Unit 2 Ty Mawr Enterprise Park, Tan y Graig Road, Llysfaen,

brewery.brewery_description: We were the first brewery in Conwy for over 100 years when we were established and we reached our tenth anniversary milestone in 2013. We specialise in cask & bottle conditioned ales of the highest quality with probably the best range of ales in North Wales. At our new premises in Llysfaen we have installed a new 25BBl brewery designed by Brendan Dobbin, the brewing engineer behind the Firkin brewpubs. We have a strong core range, seasonal specials and we have innovated with our new brand, West Coast Brewing to showcase modern beer styles with California, Riptide Black IPA, Surfin IPA and San Francisco so far and more planned in the future.

beer.beer_description: Well balanced golden ale with a hint of Welsh honey and a clean, crisp finish.

items.badge_description: Happy Untappd anniversary to you! Thanks for sticking around and drinking socially with us. Cheers! That's 5 years on Untappd!

Want to enjoy a day of brews, but need to keep your wits sharp? There are plenty of delicious brews under 5% for you to sip on throughout the day. That's 10 different beers with an ABV of 5% and lower. Try 5 more for Level 3!
It takes the perfect amount of light, the right framing and a touch of creative love to get the perfect picture of your brew. Now it’s time to drink it! That’s 5 check-ins with a photo.

Round and round the wheel goes! Which style you’ll be drinking, nobody knows! Your desire to explore different styles is inspiring. Keep it up! That's a check-in to at least 15 different styles. Try 5 more for Level 4!

beer.beer_description: Something a bit different for Christmas… A golden, refreshing ale with a really fresh, hoppy nose. More hops come through on the finish with herbal/lemony notes. A tasty ale – Yule be coming back for more!

Something a bit different for Christmas… A golden, refreshing ale with a really fresh, hoppy nose. More hops come through on the finish with herbal/lemony notes. A tasty ale – Yule be coming back for more!

A copper coloured bitter with a well balanced blend of malt & hops. 
An initial rich, malty mouth feel is rounded off by orangey / zesty hops and a touch of spice.

items.badge_description: There's beer in them thar hills! You're setting off on your journey through the world of beer, but be sure to take a little time to get to know each brewery as you go. That's a beer from 125 different breweries. Try 5 more for Level 26!

Whether you’re feeling extra special or extra strong, stopping by the local pub for a delicious Extra Special / Strong Bitter or English Bitter is always a good decision! That's 30 different beers with the style of Extra Special / Strong Bitter or English Bitter. Try 5 more for Level 7!
Had enough tea and biscuits? Head to the pub for a pint! That's at least 130 beers from the UK. Try 5 more for Level 27.

While small, the brewing tradition of Wales is quite robust. As early as the 6th century the country began to form its very own distinct styles. That's 5 different beers from a brewery from Wales. Try 5 more for Level 2!

Thanks for staying at home, and checking in with Untappd! It allows us to stay connected to a community of beer lovers, just like you, even if we can't be in the same physical location. From our home to yours, cheers and stay safe!

It's time to give bottle shops some love by adding them as your purchased location. That's 145 check-ins with a purchased location! Tag 5 more to get to Level 30. Want to learn more about this badge? Check out our podcast

Formerly named 'San Francisco'.

Seen at ABV of 3.6% on cask and 4% in bottles.
Golden session ale hopped with Galaxy, Cascade & Citra. Beautiful hoppy citrus aroma & flavour.

A copper coloured bitter with a well balanced blend of malt & hops. 
An initial rich, malty mouth feel is rounded off by orangey / zesty hops and a touch of spice.

4.5% on cask; 4.8% bottled.

Malty chestnut brown colour. Hints of chocolate malt with a super smooth mouthfeel.

Cask ABV: 5.5%, Bottle ABV: 5.8%.

Quad hopped American IPA. Massive hit of hops up front balanced by a malty backbone followed by a bitter finish.

Formerly named 'San Francisco'.
Highly refreshing blonde with a delicate grapefruit flavour and aroma.
Well balanced golden ale with a hint of Welsh honey and a clean, crisp finish.

Something a bit different for Christmas… A golden, refreshing ale with a really fresh, hoppy nose. More hops come through on the finish with herbal/lemony notes. A tasty ale – Yule be coming back for more!
Delicious citrus hoppy aromas with a good balance of sweet malt & rounded bitterness.

Combining the best of dark roasted flavours and the great citrus hoppy aromas of American IPAs.

Hops - Columbus, Cascade, Mosaic
This golden ale is brewed in the style of an American IPA, with a grapefruit hop aroma followed by a full, zesty flavour which continues to the bitter finish.
Authentic Victorian style Porter. Chocolate malt, toffee and hints of dried fruit and liquorice.
Enticing floral aromas with some citrus followed by a sweet malt finish

Tropical fruit aromas followed by sweet malts and a gentle hoppy bitter aftertaste.

Hops: First Gold | Cascade | Citra | Ekuanot

Named after a village near Wrexham, this beer was brewed for Heston Blumenthal's show Pub in a Pie. A delicate amber ale with heather flowers steeped into the beer as it ferments giving it a soft herbal/floral aroma and flavour.
U.S.style brown malty beer with a big hop finish. Brewed with Centennial and Citra hops.

A traditional IPA packed with British hops, delivering an assertive bitterness and plenty of hop flavour, balanced by a subtle maltiness, and leading to a spicy, peppery finish. Hops: Challenger, East Kent Goldings, Fuggles and Pioneer.

This seasonal red beer is brewed in the style of an American red ale, with distinctive citrus hop notes
balanced by rich roasted and dark malt flavours.
Hoppy aroma, followed by more hops in the flavour and on the finish, balanced by a touch of malt sweetness.
